intro: Phragmotheca amazonica var. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian thornapple, is a perennial herb native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. This species is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
